title: Blended ODE (Ordinary Differential Equations) Competency Enhancement Course for Working Professionals: Scientific Modeling and Experimental Data Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in basic calculus and linear algebra, and foundational understanding of scientific inquiry methods (hypothesis formulation, experimental design)
context.additional_context: Weekend intensive training for working professionals emphasizing ODE modeling competencies applicable to workplace tasks. Includes measurement data analysis from industrial settings, scientific conclusion derivation, and feedback-driven problem-solving skill development

learning_goals: Learners can solve physics/engineering practical problems (e.g., vibration, heat transfer) by applying analytical solution methods for first- and second-order linear ordinary differential equations.
Learners can model and interpret nonlinear differential equations using Laplace transforms and derive scientific evidence based on experimental data.

Learners can take two science courses (differential equations, numerical analysis) on a MOOC platform, establish and execute a weekly learning plan (three or more sessions) linked to classroom activities (variable-controlled experiment design, result analysis), and submit a learning journal and performance report (including study hours, comprehension assessment, application cases) at the end of the course.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
